alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 8:08PM CDT until March 26 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Heavy rainfall of 2-3 inches inches is forecast over the next 36 hours for the Sucarnoochee River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Sucarnoochee River. Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday afternoon to a crest of 18.4 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
